## Description
A memory leak issue has been detected in Inflight. A local attacker could exploit this in order to cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition via a crash of the node process or an application crash. 

**Note:** The Inflight project has not been updated for some time and may no longer be maintained.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2017-4131](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2017-4131) - Inflight Vulnerable to Denial-of-Service (DoS) via Memory Leak in 'makeres' Function





## Workaround
Currently there is no official fix for this issue, however, some users have discussed potential workarounds in the [vulnerability thread](https://github.com/isaacs/inflight/issues/5):

It may be possible to define specific package overrides to force the use of packages that do not depend on Inflight. Such an approach depends on the availability of packages that have removed the Inflight dependency.



## Dependency tree
- owasp-nodejs-goat/1.3.0/-npm
    - grunt/1.0.3
        - glob/7.0.6
            - inflight/1.0.6

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: uglify-js 2.4.24 from swig 1.4.2 (CVE-2015-8858 BDSA-2015-0031)

fullDescription.text:
The uglify-js package is vulnerable to a denial-of-service condition due to CPU consumption when parsing a certain types of input. This can cause an application running the uglify-js package to hang by blocking the event loop. 

An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by supplying crafted input to the `parse()` function call.

## Description
The uglify-js package is vulnerable to a denial-of-service condition due to CPU consumption when parsing a certain types of input. This can cause an application running the uglify-js package to hang by blocking the event loop. 

An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by supplying crafted input to the `parse()` function call.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)

## Solution
Fixed in version [**2.6.0**](https://www.npmjs.com/package/uglify-js).

Fixed under Debian package via experimental repository in version [**3.3.10-1**](https://wiki.debian.org/DebianExperimental).

Note: Experimental is a staging/collaboration/experimental area for development and is not fit for production.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: minimist 1.2.5 from forever 2.0.0 (CVE-2021-44906 BDSA-2022-0771)

fullDescription.text:
Minimist contains a prototype pollution vulnerability. A remote attacker could exploit this issue by adding or modifying properties of `Function.prototype`, which may lead to execution of arbitrary code.

**Note:** This vulnerability occurs from an incomplete fix of **CVE-2020-7598**, where the `Object`, `String` and `Number` prototypes are fixed, but not `Function`.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: minimist 1.2.5 from forever 2.0.0 (BDSA-2020-4373)

fullDescription.text:
minimist is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype` via a `constructor` or `__proto__` payload.

**Note**: This issue was not properly fixed and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2021-44906** (BDSA-2022-0771).

## Description
Growl is vulnerable to command injection as it does not sufficiently sanitize the user-supplied input before passing it to `exec`. This can lead to arbitrary code execution on the vulnerable system.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2017-3090](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2017-3090)([CVE-2017-16042](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-16042)) - Growl Vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution via Command Injection through 'exec'


## Solution
Fixed in [**1.10.0**](https://github.com/tj/node-growl/releases/tag/v1.10.0) by [this](https://github.com/tj/node-growl/commit/d71177d5331c9de4658aca62e0ac921f178b0669) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/tj/node-growl/tags).





## Dependency tree
- owasp-nodejs-goat/1.3.0/-npm
    - mocha/2.5.3
        - growl/1.9.2

* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-94](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/94.html)

## Description
The Underscore Javascript library contains an arbitrary code execution vulnerability.  This allows an attacker to create malicious content that, if processed by Underscore may lead to the execution of code on a system.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2021-1143](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2021-1143)([CVE-2021-23358](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-23358)) - Underscore Vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution via '_.templateSettings.variable' Value


## Solution
Fixed in:                  
* [**1.12.1**](https://github.com/jashkenas/underscore/releases/tag/1.12.1) by [this](https://github.com/jashkenas/underscore/commit/bf5a0ed27599f99ea59a0839c5bc2fb27a46c1cf) commit.
* [**1.13.0-2**](https://github.com/jashkenas/underscore/releases/tag/1.13.0-2) by [this](https://github.com/jashkenas/underscore/commit/bf5a0ed27599f99ea59a0839c5bc2fb27a46c1cf) commit.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: set-value 2.0.0 from nodemon 1.19.1 (CVE-2019-10747 BDSA-2019-4362)

fullDescription.text:
set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).

## Description
set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2019-4362](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2019-4362)([CVE-2019-10747](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10747)) - set-value Vulnerable to Prototype Pollution via 'set' Function


## Solution
Fixed in version [**4.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/4.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/383b72d47c74a55ae8b6e231da548f9280a4296a) commit.

Fixed in [**2.0.1**](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases/tag/2.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/commit/cb12f14955dde6e61829d70d1851bfea6a3c31ad) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/set-value/releases).

## Description
Apache Commons Lang is affected by an uncontrolled recursion vulnerability in the `ClassUtils.getClass` method. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw by providing excessively long or deeply nested input strings, leading to a StackOverflowError and resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2025-6881](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2025-6881)([CVE-2025-48924](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-48924)) - Apache Commons Lang Vulnerable to Denial-of-Service (DoS) via Uncontrolled Recursion leading to Stack Overflow in 'ClassUtils.getClass' Method


## Solution
Fixed in version [**3.18.0-RC1**](https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/releases/tag/commons-lang-3.18.0-RC1) by [this](https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/b424803abdb2bec818e4fbcb251ce031c22aca53) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/tags).

Fixed by [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/760d0a13912f788893b55d8f295dd47520b9d397) commit and [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/1c045cac47718c1c18c08df770ca0451e66e4e62) commit in:
* **[6.4.0](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.4.0)**
* **[6.3.2](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.3.2)**
* **[6.2.3](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.2.3)**
* **[6.1.2](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.1.2)**
* **[6.0.4](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases/tag/v6.0.4)**

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/releases).

Note: initially the vendor partially fixed this issue with [this](https://github.com/ljharb/qs/commit/beade029171b8cef9cee0d03ebe577e2dd84976d) commit, before it was discovered that this still allowed an attacker to exploit the issue using a prefixed `[` character, thus the above further commits were required.

            - qs/5.2.1

## Description
Selenium contains a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability. An unprivileged attacker could exploit this by using the config file to set a custom handler. This may lead to the execution of remote code.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2021-4248](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2021-4248) - Selenium Vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE) via 'Grid4' Component



## Solution
The Selenium `Grid4` Documentation has been updated [here](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/seleniumhq.github.io/commit/ef4a424c3a6a52b94f62b397baf84f7707ca6160) which warns users about not leaving a Grid exposed. 

A recommendation has also been included [here](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/9526) to use `basic auth` to help mitigate the risk and protect Grids. The following commits introduce and reference this functionality in Selenium version [**4.0.0-rc-1**](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/releases/tag/selenium-4.0.0-rc-1):
* [Commit 1](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/63fd7f722d36dd4942a574c8569a4b2ec4849e2f).
* [Commit 2](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/53ad48fbf4349413356d5a9a9589288ca6ed1d7a).
* [Commit 3](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/39b35f886ffdad505e29ae9ec6082c706a735d85).
* [Commit 4](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/commit/2c437713b336ca516aca2666da672500fb862c36).







## References
* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-429](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/429.html)

## Description
Selenium Grid is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS) due to the insufficient sanitization of user input. This allows attackers to execute arbitrary web scripts in a victim's browser via a crafted payload. This could allow the attacker to steal information from a victim, such as browser cookies, or to manipulate the contents of the web page.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2020-4845](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2020-4845) - Selenium Vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via Insufficient Sanitization in '/grid/console' Page



## Solution
The vendor states [here](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/issues/8259#issuecomment-632920668) that:
* Grid **3.x** is deprecated and not under development anymore.
* Grid **4** will have a different UI.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: minio 8.5.5 (CVE-2025-59952 BDSA-2025-14119)

fullDescription.text:
The MinIO client SDK for Java is vulnerable to an information disclosure issue due to how XML tag values that reference system properties or environment variables are substituted with these values during XML processing. Applications that use `minio-java` to parse XML that can contain untrusted input are affected by this issue.

An attacker could submit a crafted XML input to an affected application with the aim of extracting sensitive information like credentials, file paths or other system configuration details.

## Description
The MinIO client SDK for Java is vulnerable to an information disclosure issue due to how XML tag values that reference system properties or environment variables are substituted with these values during XML processing. Applications that use `minio-java` to parse XML that can contain untrusted input are affected by this issue.

An attacker could submit a crafted XML input to an affected application with the aim of extracting sensitive information like credentials, file paths or other system configuration details.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2025-14119](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2025-14119)([CVE-2025-59952](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-59952)) - MinIO Java SDK Vulnerable to Information Disclosure via XML Tag Injection Flaw


## Solution
Fixed in [**8.6.0**](https://github.com/minio/minio-java/releases/tag/8.6.0) by [this](https://github.com/minio/minio-java/commit/f7a98d06b25e5464bdd4811b044e25ff9101d37f) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/minio/minio-java/releases).

## Workaround
The vendor has stated in the [official advisory](https://github.com/minio/minio-java/security/advisories/GHSA-h7rh-xfpj-hpcm) that while a full workaround does not exist without upgrading, users can opt to apply the following interim measures:
> * Refrain from processing XML data from untrusted or external sources.
> * Implement input sanitization or validation to detect and remove references to system properties or environment variables in XML content.

## Locations
* /com/google/#.bridge/blackduck_sca_detect_execution/detect/tools/Black_Duck_Scan_Installation/scan.cli-1.0.7/lib/scan.cli-1.0.7-standalone.jar
* /com/google/common/#.bridge/blackduck_sca_detect_execution/detect/tools/Black_Duck_Scan_Installation/scan.cli-1.0.7/lib/cache/scan.cli.impl-standalone.jar




## References

* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-112](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/112.html)
* Common Weakness Enumeration: [CWE-200](https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/200.html)

## Description
Moment.js is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to an inefficient regular expression in use within the `rfc2822` parsing code.

An attacker could submit a crafted input containing more that 10,000 characters in order to trigger an excessive consumption of resources that result in a slowdown of processing.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2022-1914](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2022-1914)([CVE-2022-31129](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-31129)) - Node.js 'Moment.js' Package Vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial-of-Service (ReDoS) via Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity in 'rfc2822' Parsing Code


## Solution
Fixed in [**2.29.4**](https://github.com/moment/moment/releases/tag/2.29.4) by [this](https://github.com/moment/moment/commit/9a3b5894f3d5d602948ac8a02e4ee528a49ca3a3) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/moment).

**Note**: The vendor has stated in their [advisory](https://github.com/moment/moment/security/advisories/GHSA-wc69-rhjr-hc9g) that the patch for **2.29.4** can be applied to all affected versions with minimal tweaking.

## Workaround
The vendor has suggested [here](https://github.com/moment/moment/security/advisories/GHSA-wc69-rhjr-hc9g) that users of Moment.js who pass a user-supplied string to a constructor should apply input length filters to help with this issue, and other potential future regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issues.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: fsevents 1.2.9 from nodemon 1.19.1 (CVE-2023-45311 BDSA-2023-1218)

fullDescription.text:
fsevents npm package is vulnerable to hijacking due to malicious code run during installation via a hijacked URL in the install configuration. This would allow the current owner of the URL to run code of their choosing on each installation of the package.

**Note:** Originally, the credentials to the S3 bucket of the affected URL were [lost](https://github.com/fsevents/fsevents/releases/tag/v1.2.11). It was demonstrated by a security researcher that the bucket became available to register once again, and it was taken over by the researcher to demonstrate possible impact of this vulnerability. At this time, AWS has taken possession of the S3 bucket and currently blocks all access, neutralizing any threat. Should this bucket become available to use in the future, affected versions of fsevents will once again become vulnerable. This occurred in August 2023, when the bucket was briefly reinstated in error.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: js-yaml 3.6.1 from grunt-if 0.2.0 (BDSA-2025-27523)

fullDescription.text:
js-yaml is vulnerable to a prototype pollution issue due to a lack of sufficient validation in the `storeMappingPair` functionality.

An attacker could supply a crafted YAML document that includes `__proto__` nodes designed to modify prototypes of the resulting parsed document. In applications that parse untrusted YAML data, this issue could lead to unexpected behavior or potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

## Description
js-yaml is vulnerable to a prototype pollution issue due to a lack of sufficient validation in the `storeMappingPair` functionality.

An attacker could supply a crafted YAML document that includes `__proto__` nodes designed to modify prototypes of the resulting parsed document. In applications that parse untrusted YAML data, this issue could lead to unexpected behavior or potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2025-27523](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2025-27523) - js-yaml Vulnerable to Prototype Pollution via Insufficient Input Validation in 'storeMappingPair' Functionality



## Solution
Fixed in [**4.1.1**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/4.1.1) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/a00312147f287a1703bf6b7e104d27c8a0caacee) commit and [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/383665ff4248ec2192d1274e934462bb30426879) commit, and in [**3.14.2**](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/releases/tag/3.14.2) by [this](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/commit/5278870a17454fe8621dbd8c445c412529525266) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/tags).

## Workaround
The vendor has supplied the following workaround advice in their official [advisory](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml/security/advisories/GHSA-mh29-5h37-fv8m):
> You can protect against this kind of attack on the server by using `node --disable-proto=delete` or `deno` (in Deno, pollution protection is on by default).

    - grunt-if/0.2.0
        - grunt-contrib-nodeunit/1.0.0

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: path-to-regexp 0.1.7 from express 4.16.4 (CVE-2024-45296 BDSA-2024-6246)

fullDescription.text:
Path-to-RegExp is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to how it is possible for an inefficient expression to be generated for some routes that make use of named parameters.

The expression generated from affected routes is susceptible to excessive backtracking. An attacker could submit a crafted path input to a vulnerable application in order to trigger the backtracking flaw when attempts to match against the path are made. The inefficient matching operations could cause excessive consumption of CPU cycles and result in degraded performance for other clients.

**Note**: the original fix for **0.1.x** releases was discovered to be incomplete, which required a further fix disclosed under **CVE-2024-52798** (**BDSA-2024-9447**).

## Description
Path-to-RegExp is vulnerable to a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue due to how it is possible for an inefficient expression to be generated for some routes that make use of named parameters.

The expression generated from affected routes is susceptible to excessive backtracking. An attacker could submit a crafted path input to a vulnerable application in order to trigger the backtracking flaw when attempts to match against the path are made. The inefficient matching operations could cause excessive consumption of CPU cycles and result in degraded performance for other clients.

**Note**: the original fix for **0.1.x** releases was discovered to be incomplete, which required a further fix disclosed under **CVE-2024-52798** (**BDSA-2024-9447**).

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2024-6246](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2024-6246)([CVE-2024-45296](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45296)) - Node.js 'path-to-regexp' Package Vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial-of-Service (ReDoS) via Inefficient Expression Generation


## Solution
The vendor has provided patches that offer varying degrees of protection against this regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issue.

Firstly, the vendor has recommended that users of versions above the **0.1.x** release series should upgrade to version [**8.0.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v8.0.0) or above.
**Note**: This release contains a large breaking change in that it outright removes the regular expression override feature.

A "backtracking protection" mechanism was developed for older releases where a large breaking change was not feasible. The mechanism is active when a custom regex pattern is not provided. This change was made available in:
* [**6.3.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v6.3.0) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/f1253b47b347dcb909e3e80b0eb2649109e59894) commit,
* [**3.3.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v3.3.0) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/d31670ae8f6e69cbfd56e835742195b7d10942ef) commit,
* [**1.9.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v1.9.0) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/925ac8e3c5780b02f58cbd4e52f95da8ad2ac485) commit,
* [**0.1.12**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v0.1.12) with [this](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/commit/f01c26a013b1889f0c217c643964513acf17f6a4) commit.

**Warning**: The "backtracking protection" mechanism does not protect against vulnerable user-supplied capture groups. The vendor considers protecting against explicit user-supplied patterns to be out of scope for old versions. The "backtracking protection" measures can also be considered a breaking change for some users.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases).

## Workaround
Version [**7.1.0**](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/releases/tag/v7.1.0) offers a non-default `strict` option that can be enabled with `strict: true` in order to receive errors where a regular expression that may cause regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS) issues is detected. This feature is documented [here](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/blob/v7.1.0/Readme.md#developers).

Aside from the workaround provided in this release, the vendor has also provided the following workaround advice in their [advisory](https://github.com/pillarjs/path-to-regexp/security/advisories/GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j) that can be applied manually:

> All versions can be patched by providing a custom regular expression for parameters after the first in a single segment. As long as the custom regular expression does not match the text before the parameter, you will be safe. For example, change `/:a-:b` to `/:a-:b([^-/]+)`.
> 
> If paths cannot be rewritten and versions cannot be upgraded, another alternative is to limit the URL length. For example, halving the attack string improves performance by 4x faster.



## Dependency tree
- owasp-nodejs-goat/1.3.0/-npm
    - express/4.16.4
        - path-to-regexp/0.1.7

The inefficient matching operations could cause excessive consumption of CPU cycles and result in degraded performance for other clients.

**Note**: the original fix for **0.1.x** releases was discovered to be incomplete, which required a further fix disclosed under **CVE-2024-52798** (**BDSA-2024-9447**).

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: lodash 4.13.1 from grunt-if 0.2.0 (BDSA-2019-3842)

fullDescription.text:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.

help.text:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: lodash 4.13.1 from grunt-if 0.2.0 (CVE-2018-16487 BDSA-2018-3818)

fullDescription.text:
Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as the user-controllable input to certain functions is not sufficiently checked, allowing an attacker to add or modify existing properties of presumably immutable `Object` data structure. An unauthenticated attacker can leverage this flaw to add arbitrary properties to objects used by the web application which can be leveraged to cause a crash or to prevent the server from responding to all requests.

This vulnerability may also lead to remote code execution (RCE) in some applications, depending on the implementation.

## Description
Lodash is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) as the user-controllable input to certain functions is not sufficiently checked, allowing an attacker to add or modify existing properties of presumably immutable `Object` data structure. An unauthenticated attacker can leverage this flaw to add arbitrary properties to objects used by the web application which can be leveraged to cause a crash or to prevent the server from responding to all requests.

This vulnerability may also lead to remote code execution (RCE) in some applications, depending on the implementation.

## Solution
Fixed in version [**4.17.11**](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/releases/tag/4.17.11) by [this](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/commit/90e6199a161b6445b01454517b40ef65ebecd2ad) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/tags).

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: lodash 4.13.1 from grunt-if 0.2.0 (CVE-2020-8203 BDSA-2020-1674)

fullDescription.text:
Lodash is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) due to the potential to modify the properties of objects in memory. A remote attacker could run arbitrary commands on a vulnerable server, or cause the server to crash, by maliciously crafting an object via the zip functionality of Lodash.

Note: this issue was not properly addressed and required an additional fix and disclosure (**BDSA-2020-3839**).

This could allow an attacker to use a malicious server in order to make requests on behalf of the application server and gather information about a victim's internal infrastructure. This vulnerability can be exploited even if there are anti-SSRF filtering measures in place.

## Description
Request package contains a vulnerability that can allow server side request forgery (SSRF) attacks using cross-protocol redirects. This could allow an attacker to use a malicious server in order to make requests on behalf of the application server and gather information about a victim's internal infrastructure. This vulnerability can be exploited even if there are anti-SSRF filtering measures in place.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2023-0576](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2023-0576)([CVE-2023-28155](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-28155)) - Request Package Vulnerable to Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) via Cross-Protocol Redirects using a Malicious Server




## Workaround
A patch has been proposed [here](https://github.com/request/request/pull/3444/commits/d42332182512e56ba68446f49c3e3711e04301a2) that has not been merged with the upstream repository yet.



## Dependency tree
- owasp-nodejs-goat/1.3.0/-npm
    - grunt-npm-install/0.3.1
        - npm/3.10.10
            - request/2.75.0

## Description
node-cross-spawn contains a regular expression catastrophic backtracking issue in its `escapeArgument` function. A remote attacker able to supply specially crafted input to this function could cause a denial-of-service (DoS).

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2024-9371](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2024-9371)([CVE-2024-21538](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21538)) - node-cross-spawn Vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via Catastrophic Backtracking in 'escapeArgument' Function


## Solution
Fixed in version [**v6.0.6**](https://github.com/moxystudio/node-cross-spawn/releases/tag/v6.0.6) by [this](https://github.com/moxystudio/node-cross-spawn/commit/ba5aaef78340f0a4523a90276306b2f45fc6859a) commit and in version [**v7.0.4**](https://github.com/moxystudio/node-cross-spawn/releases/tag/v7.0.4) by [this](https://github.com/moxystudio/node-cross-spawn/commit/5ff3a07d9add449021d806e45c4168203aa833ff) commit.

## Description
qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the excessive time required to process `proto` properties of the output JavaScript objects. An unauthenticated attacker could send a request with a manipulated `proto` properties and cause the Node server to freeze as it tries to process the input.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: minimist 0.0.8 from grunt 1.0.3 (CVE-2021-44906 BDSA-2022-0771)

fullDescription.text:
Minimist contains a prototype pollution vulnerability. A remote attacker could exploit this issue by adding or modifying properties of `Function.prototype`, which may lead to execution of arbitrary code.

**Note:** This vulnerability occurs from an incomplete fix of **CVE-2020-7598**, where the `Object`, `String` and `Number` prototypes are fixed, but not `Function`.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: minimist 0.0.8 from grunt 1.0.3 (CVE-2020-7598 BDSA-2020-4373)

fullDescription.text:
minimist is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype` via a `constructor` or `__proto__` payload.

**Note**: This issue was not properly fixed and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2021-44906** (BDSA-2022-0771).

## Description
minimist is vulnerable to a prototype pollution attack. A remote attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code, or cause a denial-of-service (DoS) by tricking the library into modifying or adding properties of `Object.prototype` via a `constructor` or `__proto__` payload.

**Note**: This issue was not properly fixed and required an additional disclosure as **CVE-2021-44906** (BDSA-2022-0771).

## Solution
Fixed in version [**1.2.6**](https://github.com/substack/minimist/releases/tag/1.2.6) by [this](https://github.com/substack/minimist/commit/c2b981977fa834b223b408cfb860f933c9811e4d) commit.

## Description
Marked is vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) due to a flaw present within a regular expression in the `src/rules.js` file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by supplying a maliciously crafted input in order to consume resources, thus resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition occurring.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2022-0106](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2022-0106)([CVE-2022-21680](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-21680)) - Marked Vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via 'block.def'


## Solution
Fixed in version [**4.0.10**](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/releases/tag/v4.0.10) by [this](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/c4a3ccd344b6929afa8a1d50ac54a721e57012c0) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/markedjs/marked/tags).

## Workaround
The vendor has proposed the following workaround:

> Do not run untrusted markdown through Marked or run Marked on a worker thread and set a reasonable time limit to prevent draining resources.

The vendor notes [here](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38808):

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-core 5.3.34-wso2v1 (BDSA-2024-6258)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework contains a path traversal flaw when used to serve static resources through the functional web frameworks `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn`. A remote attacker could leverage this to read arbitrary files that the application has system read rights to.

**Note**: The application is only vulnerable when it uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources and resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location.

## Description
Spring Framework contains a path traversal flaw when used to serve static resources through the functional web frameworks `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn`. A remote attacker could leverage this to read arbitrary files that the application has system read rights to.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-core 5.3.34-wso2v1 (BDSA-2024-7391)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a path traversal issue due to a lack of sufficient sanitization of path sequences processed by the `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn` functional web frameworks.

A remote attacker could submit crafted HTTP requests to an application that serves static resources through the affected frameworks in order to read any file on the system that is accessible to the process in which the Spring application is running.

An application is vulnerable when both of the following are true:
* the web application uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources, and
* resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location

The vendor has noted in the official [advisory](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38819) that malicious requests are blocked and rejected when the Spring Security HTTP Firewall is in use.

**Note**: This issue exists due to an insufficient fix for the previously reported path traversal issue **CVE-2024-38816** (**BDSA-2024-6528**). Unlike **CVE-2024-38816**, applications deployed on Tomcat or Jetty are vulnerable.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-core 5.3.34-wso2v1 (BDSA-2025-8611)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal when it has been deployed on a non-compliant servlet container. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in order to view sensitive information.

An application can be vulnerable when all the following are true:
* the application is deployed as a WAR or with an embedded Servlet container,
* the Servlet container does not reject suspicious sequences,
* the application serves static resources with Spring resource handling.

**Note**: The vendor has stated that applications deployed on Apache Tomcat or Eclipse Jetty are not vulnerable, as long as default security features are not disabled in the configuration.

help.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal when it has been deployed on a non-compliant servlet container. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in order to view sensitive information.

An application can be vulnerable when all the following are true:
* the application is deployed as a WAR or with an embedded Servlet container,
* the Servlet container does not reject suspicious sequences,
* the application serves static resources with Spring resource handling.

**Note**: The vendor has stated that applications deployed on Apache Tomcat or Eclipse Jetty are not vulnerable, as long as default security features are not disabled in the configuration.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-core 5.3.34-wso2v1 (BDSA-2025-11864)

fullDescription.text:
The Spring Framework might not correctly detect annotations on methods if those methods are part of a class hierarchy that uses generic types without specific type limits. If these annotations are used for authorization purposes, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in order to reveal information that they should not have access to.

**Note:** The vendor has stated that only instances of spring that use the `@EnableMethodSecurity` setting or use security annotations on methods in generic superclasses or generic interfaces are vulnerable.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-core 5.3.34-wso2v1 (CVE-2024-38820 BDSA-2024-7393)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework contains locale-dependent exceptions in the `disallowedFields` patterns in the `DataBinder` component. This could allow an attacker to bypass field protections and potentially manipulate protected fields.

**Note:** after this CVE was fixed it was discovered that there are still cases where it is possible to bypass the disallowedFields checks, resulting in **CVE-2025-22233** and a second fix.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-core 5.3.34-wso2v1 (BDSA-2025-13947)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) issue due to the presence of a security bypass flaw in the STOMP protocol functionality. Applications that use STOMP over WebSocket are affected by this issue.

An attacker could trick a victim user into viewing crafted web content that sends requests to an affected application and abuses improper state management to bypass security measures and send unauthorized messages on the victim user's behalf.

## Description
A privilege escalation vulnerability in the Scala compilation daemon allows a local attacker to write arbitrary class files and execute code as the user that started the daemon. The vulnerability is caused by using weak permissions for private files in `/tmp/scaladev/${USER:shared}/scalac-compile-server-port`.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2017-1963](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2017-1963)([CVE-2017-15288](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-15288)) - Scala Compilation Daemon Vulnerable To Privilege Escalation via Weak Private File Permissions


## Solution
Fixed in:
* [**2.12.4**](https://github.com/scala/scala/releases/tag/v2.12.4) by [this](https://github.com/scala/scala/commit/67fcf5ce4496000574676d81ed72e4a6cb9e7757) commit,
* [**2.11.12**](https://github.com/scala/scala/releases/tag/v2.11.12) by [this](https://github.com/scala/scala/commit/f3419fc358a8ea6e366538126279da88d4d1fb1f) commit,
* [**2.10.7**](https://github.com/scala/scala/releases/tag/v2.10.7) by [this](https://github.com/scala/scala/commit/0f624c5e5bdb39967e208c7c16067c3e6c903f1f) commit.

## Workaround
The vendor has given the following mitigation advice:
 1. Use `scala -nocompdaemon MyScript.scala` rather than `scala MyScript.scala` to
    disable the implicit startup and use of the daemon.  
 2. Avoid explicitly starting `fsc`.

## Description
qs is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to the excessive time required to process `proto` properties of the output JavaScript objects. An unauthenticated attacker could send a request with a manipulated `proto` properties and cause the Node server to freeze as it tries to process the input.

If handlebars is used to run on the server side, remote code execution is possible.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-web 5.3.34 (CVE-2025-41249 BDSA-2025-11864)

fullDescription.text:
The Spring Framework might not correctly detect annotations on methods if those methods are part of a class hierarchy that uses generic types without specific type limits. If these annotations are used for authorization purposes, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in order to reveal information that they should not have access to.

**Note:** The vendor has stated that only instances of spring that use the `@EnableMethodSecurity` setting or use security annotations on methods in generic superclasses or generic interfaces are vulnerable.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-web 5.3.34 (CVE-2025-41242 BDSA-2025-8611)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal when it has been deployed on a non-compliant servlet container. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in order to view sensitive information.

An application can be vulnerable when all the following are true:
* the application is deployed as a WAR or with an embedded Servlet container,
* the Servlet container does not reject suspicious sequences,
* the application serves static resources with Spring resource handling.

**Note**: The vendor has stated that applications deployed on Apache Tomcat or Eclipse Jetty are not vulnerable, as long as default security features are not disabled in the configuration.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2024-5369](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2024-5369)([CVE-2024-38809](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38809)) - Spring Framework Vulnerable to Denial-of-Service (DoS) via Inefficient Regular Expression for 'If-Match' or 'If-None-Match' ETag Processing


## Solution
Fixed in
* [**5.3.38**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v5.3.38) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/582bfccbb7) commit.
* [**6.0.23**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.0.23) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/8d16a50907c11f7e6b407d878a26e84eba08a533) commit.
* [**6.1.12**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.1.12) and [**6.2.0-M7**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.2.0-M7) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/bb17ad8314b81850a939fd265fb53b3361705e85) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/tags).

## Workaround
The vendor notes [here](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38809):
> Users of older, unsupported versions could enforce a size limit on "If-Match" and "If-None-Match" headers, e.g. through a Filter.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-web 5.3.34 (BDSA-2024-7391)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a path traversal issue due to a lack of sufficient sanitization of path sequences processed by the `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn` functional web frameworks.

A remote attacker could submit crafted HTTP requests to an application that serves static resources through the affected frameworks in order to read any file on the system that is accessible to the process in which the Spring application is running.

An application is vulnerable when both of the following are true:
* the web application uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources, and
* resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location

The vendor has noted in the official [advisory](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38819) that malicious requests are blocked and rejected when the Spring Security HTTP Firewall is in use.

**Note**: This issue exists due to an insufficient fix for the previously reported path traversal issue **CVE-2024-38816** (**BDSA-2024-6528**). Unlike **CVE-2024-38816**, applications deployed on Tomcat or Jetty are vulnerable.

**Note**: This issue exists due to an insufficient fix for the previously reported path traversal issue **CVE-2024-38816** (**BDSA-2024-6528**). Unlike **CVE-2024-38816**, applications deployed on Tomcat or Jetty are vulnerable.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-web 5.3.34 (BDSA-2024-6258)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework contains a path traversal flaw when used to serve static resources through the functional web frameworks `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn`. A remote attacker could leverage this to read arbitrary files that the application has system read rights to.

**Note**: The application is only vulnerable when it uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources and resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location.

## Description
Spring Framework contains a path traversal flaw when used to serve static resources through the functional web frameworks `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn`. A remote attacker could leverage this to read arbitrary files that the application has system read rights to.

**Note**: The application is only vulnerable when it uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources and resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2024-6258](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2024-6258) - Spring Framework Vulnerable to Arbitrary File Read via Path Traversal in WebMvc.fn or WebFlux.fn Components



## Solution
Fixed in [**6.2.0-rc2**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.2.0-RC2) and [**6.1.14**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.1.14) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/3bfbe30a7814c9ea1556d40df9bd87ddb3ba372d) commit and [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/fb7890d73975a3d9e0763e0926df2bd0a608e87e) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases).

## Workaround
The vendor supplies the following suggestion [here](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38816):
> Users of older, unsupported versions could enable Spring Security's Firewall in their application, or switch to using Tomcat or Jetty as a Web server because they reject such malicious requests.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-web 5.3.34 (CVE-2025-41254 BDSA-2025-13947)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) issue due to the presence of a security bypass flaw in the STOMP protocol functionality. Applications that use STOMP over WebSocket are affected by this issue.

An attacker could trick a victim user into viewing crafted web content that sends requests to an affected application and abuses improper state management to bypass security measures and send unauthorized messages on the victim user's behalf.

## Description
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) issue due to the presence of a security bypass flaw in the STOMP protocol functionality. Applications that use STOMP over WebSocket are affected by this issue.

An attacker could trick a victim user into viewing crafted web content that sends requests to an affected application and abuses improper state management to bypass security measures and send unauthorized messages on the victim user's behalf.

## Description
It was discovered that the fix for Spring Framework **CVE-2024-38820** (field protection bypass via locale-dependent exceptions in the `disallowedFields` patterns) is incomplete. There are still cases where it is possible to bypass the `disallowedFields` checks and potentially manipulate protected fields.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:large_blue_circle: [BDSA-2025-4226](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2025-4226)([CVE-2025-22233](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22233)) - Spring Framework Vulnerable to Field Manipulation via DataBinder Case Sensitive Match Exception


## Solution
Fixed in:
* [**6.1.20**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.1.20) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/edfcc6ffb1) commit,
* [**6.2.7**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.2.7) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/ee62701f56) commit,
* [**7.0.0-M5**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v7.0.0-M5) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/ee62701f56) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/tags).

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-web 5.3.34 (CVE-2024-38820 BDSA-2024-7393)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework contains locale-dependent exceptions in the `disallowedFields` patterns in the `DataBinder` component. This could allow an attacker to bypass field protections and potentially manipulate protected fields.

**Note:** after this CVE was fixed it was discovered that there are still cases where it is possible to bypass the disallowedFields checks, resulting in **CVE-2025-22233** and a second fix.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: shelljs 0.3.0 from jshint 2.12.0 (CVE-2022-0144 BDSA-2022-0052)

fullDescription.text:
ShellJS is vulnerable to privilege escalation and denial-of-service (DoS) issues due to how file permissions used by the internal implementation of `shell.exec()` are mishandled.

If ShellJS scripts running locally are using the ShellJS `exec()` function, an attacker with low-level privileges on the system could abuse the flaw in order to leak sensitive information, such as passwords, in order to perform local privilege escalation or shutdown privileged ShellJS processes.

A vendor comment [here](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/issues/1058#issuecomment-1008657537) indicates that this issue only impacts the `synchronous` version of `shell.exec()`. All other ShellJS methods (including the `async` usage of `shell.exec()`) should not be impacted.

## Description
ShellJS is vulnerable to privilege escalation and denial-of-service (DoS) issues due to how file permissions used by the internal implementation of `shell.exec()` are mishandled.

If ShellJS scripts running locally are using the ShellJS `exec()` function, an attacker with low-level privileges on the system could abuse the flaw in order to leak sensitive information, such as passwords, in order to perform local privilege escalation or shutdown privileged ShellJS processes.

A vendor comment [here](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/issues/1058#issuecomment-1008657537) indicates that this issue only impacts the `synchronous` version of `shell.exec()`. All other ShellJS methods (including the `async` usage of `shell.exec()`) should not be impacted.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2022-0052](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2022-0052)([CVE-2022-0144](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-0144)) - Node.js 'shelljs' Package Vulnerable to Privilege Escalation and Denial-of-Service (DoS) via 'shell.exec' Improper Privilege Management


## Solution
Fixed in [**0.8.5**](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/releases/tag/v0.8.5) by [this](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs/commit/d919d22dd6de385edaa9d90313075a77f74b338c) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/shelljs).

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: shelljs 0.3.0 from jshint 2.12.0 (BDSA-2022-0115)

fullDescription.text:
ShellJS is vulnerable to information disclosure due to the unsafe handling of the `stdout` and `stderr` streams of the `shell.exec()` function. A local attacker could potentially obtain sensitive data that has been produced by processes by examining the `stdout` file that is produced by ShellJS. This vulnerability can also be leveraged to crash privileged ShellJS processes.

It should be noted that only the synchronous version of `shell.exec()` function is affected by this issue.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: lodash 4.17.11 from grunt-jsbeautifier 0.2.13 (BDSA-2019-3842)

fullDescription.text:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: tar 2.2.1 from grunt-npm-install 0.3.1 (CVE-2021-32803 BDSA-2021-2334)

fullDescription.text:
The node-tar package is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite issues due to a flaw in the symlink protection measures that allows for an untrusted tar file to symlink into an arbitrary location.

An attacker could poison the directory cache by first creating a directory and replacing it with a symlink with the same name. This allows the attacker to bypass symlink checks on directories and enable them to extract arbitrary files into potentially sensitive locations. The attacker could use this flaw to overwrite files to enable arbitrary code execution attacks.

## Description
The node-tar package is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite issues due to a flaw in the symlink protection measures that allows for an untrusted tar file to symlink into an arbitrary location.

An attacker could poison the directory cache by first creating a directory and replacing it with a symlink with the same name. This allows the attacker to bypass symlink checks on directories and enable them to extract arbitrary files into potentially sensitive locations. The attacker could use this flaw to overwrite files to enable arbitrary code execution attacks.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2021-2334](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2021-2334)([CVE-2021-32803](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-32803)) - node-tar Vulnerable to Arbitrary File Creation/Overwrite via Insufficient Symlink Protection due to Directory Cache Poisoning


## Solution
Fixed in:
* [**3.2.3**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v3.2.3) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/85d3a942b4064e4ff171f91696fced7975167349) commit,
* [**4.4.15**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.15) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/46fe35083e2676e31c4e0a81639dce6da7aaa356) commit, 
* [**5.0.7**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v5.0.7) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/5987d9a41f6bfbf1ddab1098e1fdcf1a5618f571) commit, 
* [**6.1.2**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v6.1.2) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/9dbdeb6df8e9dbd96fa9e84341b9d74734be6c20) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases).

## Workaround
It is suggested on [npmjs.com](https://www.npmjs.com/advisories/1771#workarounds) that it is possible to mitigate the vulnerability by creating a custom `onentry` method which sanitizes the `entry.path` or a `filter` method which removes entries with absolute paths.



## Dependency tree
- owasp-nodejs-goat/1.3.0/-npm
    - grunt-npm-install/0.3.1
        - npm/3.10.10
            - tar/2.2.1

This allows the attacker to bypass symlink checks on directories and enable them to extract arbitrary files into potentially sensitive locations. The attacker could use this flaw to overwrite files to enable arbitrary code execution attacks.

## Description
The tar package for Node.js is vulnerable to arbitrary file creation/overwrite and arbitrary code execution via directory cache poisoning.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2021-2632](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2021-2632)([CVE-2021-37712](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-37712)) - tar Vulnerable to Arbitrary File Creation/Overwrite/Code Execution via Directory Cache Poisoning


## Solution
Fixed in:
* [**4.4.18**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v4.4.18) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/3f2e2da3866c4e5f26ca0c0d6721cb371c5a3933) commit and [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/bb93ba243746f705092905da1955ac3b0509ba1e). 
* [**5.0.10**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v5.0.10) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/ab3e9036dc4504413fb6f154ea6943af5c187e26) commit and [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/1739408d3122af897caefd09662bce2ea477533b) commit. 
* [**6.1.9**](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/releases/tag/v6.1.9) by [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/b6162c7fafe797f856564ef37f4b82747f051455) commit and [this](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/commit/53602669f58ddbeb3294d7196b3320aaaed22728) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/npm/node-tar/tags).

## Workaround
Users can workaround this vulnerability by creating a custom filter method (`x` in this example) which prevents all symbolic links from being extracted:

```
const tar = require('tar')

tar.x({
  file: 'archive.tgz',
  filter: (file, entry) => {
    if (entry.type === 'SymbolicLink') {
      return false
    } else {
      return true
    }
  }
})
```

shortDescription.text: Dependency: protobuf-java 3.20.3 (CVE-2024-7254 BDSA-2024-6519)

fullDescription.text:
protobuf-java is vulnerable to denial-of-service (DoS) due to improper handling of nested SGROUP tags when parsing with `DiscardUnknownFieldsParser`, the Java Protobuf Lite parser, or against Protobuf map fields. This could allow an attacker to trigger unbounded recursions which can lead to a stack overflow.

**Note**: the vendor states that this issue affects all versions of both the Java full and lite Protobuf runtimes, as well as Protobuf for Kotlin and JRuby, which themselves use the Java Protobuf runtime.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: babel-traverse 6.11.4 from grunt-if 0.2.0 (CVE-2023-45133 BDSA-2023-2769)

fullDescription.text:
Babel Traverse is vulnerable to an arbitrary code execution issue due to how the `_evaluate()` function allows for the evaluation of inherited methods. This affects plugins that rely on the `path.evaluate()` or `path.evaluateTruthy()` internal Babel methods.

In cases where Babel is used to compile untrusted code, an attacker could potentially submit specially crafted code that, during compilation, could be evaluated and executed during the compilation process.

[Click Here To See More Details in Black Duck](https://saastest.app.blackduck.com/api/projects/ebe9acf8-4198-4977-a23d-6c25c6f7bbf4/versions/4b97f6f7-bac1-4a13-9233-34a4e5b27877/vulnerabilities?filter=bomComponents%3AaHR0cHM6Ly9zYWFzdGVzdC5hcHAuYmxhY2tkdWNrLmNvbS9hcGkvY29tcG9uZW50cy9iZDI2NTJhMy03NGVhLTQ0YTktODg4OS1mM2U5OGFhNGRmYTAvdmVyc2lvbnMvNzQwNGRmMGYtZGFlMC00OGY1LWE0MGItNTk3MmI3YTkzNWVi)


## Description
Babel Traverse is vulnerable to an arbitrary code execution issue due to how the `_evaluate()` function allows for the evaluation of inherited methods. This affects plugins that rely on the `path.evaluate()` or `path.evaluateTruthy()` internal Babel methods.

In cases where Babel is used to compile untrusted code, an attacker could potentially submit specially crafted code that, during compilation, could be evaluated and executed during the compilation process.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2023-2769](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2023-2769)([CVE-2023-45133](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-45133)) - Babel Traverse Vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution via Evaluation of Inherited Methods


## Solution
Fixed in [**8.0.0-alpha4**](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/traverse/v/8.0.0-alpha.4) and [**7.23.2**](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/traverse/v/7.23.2) by [this](https://github.com/babel/babel/commit/b13376b346946e3f62fc0848c1d2a23223314c82) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@babel/traverse).

## Workaround
The vendor has provided the following workaround suggestion in their [advisory](https://github.com/babel/babel/security/advisories/GHSA-67hx-6x53-jw92):
> If you cannot upgrade `@babel/traverse` and are using one of the affected packages, upgrade them to their latest version to avoid triggering the vulnerable code path in affected `@babel/traverse` versions:
> 
>     @babel/plugin-transform-runtime v7.23.2
>     @babel/preset-env v7.23.2
>     @babel/helper-define-polyfill-provider v0.4.3
>     babel-plugin-polyfill-corejs2 v0.4.6
>     babel-plugin-polyfill-corejs3 v0.8.5
>     babel-plugin-polyfill-es-shims v0.10.0
>     babel-plugin-polyfill-regenerator v0.5.3



## Dependency tree
- owasp-nodejs-goat/1.3.0/-npm
    - grunt-if/0.2.0
        - grunt-contrib-nodeunit/1.0.0
            - nodeunit/0.9.5
                - tap/7.1.2
                    - nyc/7.1.0
                        - istanbul-lib-instrument/1.1.0-alpha.4

As per the [Advisory](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m6fv-jmcg-4jfg).

shortDescription.text: Dependency: tika-core 1.28.4 (CVE-2025-54988 BDSA-2025-9587)

fullDescription.text:
Apache Tika is vulnerable to an XML external entities (XXE) injection vulnerability due to how the `PDFParser` functionality, `(tike-parser-pdf-module`), automatically resolves external entities present in XML Forms Architecture (XFA) resources.

An attacker could submit a crafted PDF file that includes malicious XFA content to an affected application in order to trigger entity expansion, which could potentially be abused in order to read sensitive data or trigger malicious requests to internal resources or third-party servers.

**Note**: The vendor has highlighted that the `tika-parser-pdf-module` is used as a dependency in multiple Tika packages including `tika-parsers-standard-modules`, `tika-parsers-standard-package`, `tika-app`, `tika-grpc` and `tika-server-standard`.

**Note:** This issue was assigned a new CVE, **CVE-2025-66516** (**BDSA-2025-43183**), as the original CVE did not list the full range of effected products and did not state that users who updated `tika-parser-pdf-module` to the fixed version but did not update `tika-core` to 3.2.2 would still be vulnerable.

help.markdown:
## Upgrade Guidance



| **Affected Dependency**  | **Recommended short term version** | **Recommended long term version** |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| tika-core 1.28.4  | 1.28.5  | 3.2.3 |

## Description
Apache Tika is vulnerable to an XML external entities (XXE) injection vulnerability due to how the `PDFParser` functionality, `(tike-parser-pdf-module`), automatically resolves external entities present in XML Forms Architecture (XFA) resources.

An attacker could submit a crafted PDF file that includes malicious XFA content to an affected application in order to trigger entity expansion, which could potentially be abused in order to read sensitive data or trigger malicious requests to internal resources or third-party servers.

**Note**: The vendor has highlighted that the `tika-parser-pdf-module` is used as a dependency in multiple Tika packages including `tika-parsers-standard-modules`, `tika-parsers-standard-package`, `tika-app`, `tika-grpc` and `tika-server-standard`.

**Note:** This issue was assigned a new CVE, **CVE-2025-66516** (**BDSA-2025-43183**), as the original CVE did not list the full range of effected products and did not state that users who updated `tika-parser-pdf-module` to the fixed version but did not update `tika-core` to 3.2.2 would still be vulnerable.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:orange_circle: [BDSA-2025-9587](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2025-9587)([CVE-2025-54988](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-54988)) - Apache Tika Vulnerable to XML External Entities (XXE) Injection in PDFParser XFA Handling


## Solution
Fixed in:
* [**3.2.2**](https://github.com/apache/tika/releases/tag/3.2.2) by [this](https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/94acef285) commit,
* the **branch_2x** branch by [this](https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/8a63590c4) commit,
* the **main** branch by [this](https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/bfee6d556) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/apache/tika/tags).

* /org/apache/tika/#.bridge/blackduck_sca_detect_execution/detect/tools/Black_Duck_Scan_Installation/scan.cli-1.0.7/lib/cache/scan.cli.impl-standalone.jar

## Description
Node.js Hawk contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this using crafted regular expressions to exhaust system resources and cause a crash.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2022-1262](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2022-1262)([CVE-2022-29167](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-29167)) - Node.js Hawk Vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial-of-Service via 'parseHost' Function


## Solution
Fixed in [**9.0.1**](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hawk/v/9.0.1) by [this](https://github.com/mozilla/hawk/commit/d10d72ca82db967f6c5fcf866ff78e3ca25ce1ab) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hawk).

## Workaround
The vendor has issued the following workaround:

"`Hawk.authenticate()` accepts the options argument. If that contains host and port, those would be used instead of a call to `utils.parseHost()`".

shortDescription.text: Direct Dependency: express 4.16.4 (CVE-2024-43796 BDSA-2024-6188)

fullDescription.text:
Express.js web framework is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) due to the improper handling of user input in the `response.redirect()` function. This could allow an attacker to execute JavaScript code on the users browser.

**Note** The attacker must be in control of the input to `response.redirect()` and the user must click before the redirect occurs.

## Description
Express.js contains an open redirect vulnerability due to insufficient validation of user supplied URLs. An attacker could exploit this by providing a crafted URL when performing a redirect bypassing the redirect allow list leading to an open redirect.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2024-0722](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2024-0722)([CVE-2024-29041](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-29041)) - Express.js Vulnerable to Open Redirect via Malformed URLs in 'res.location' Method


## Solution
Fixed in version [**4.19.0**](https://github.com/expressjs/express/releases/tag/4.19.0) and [**5.0.0-beta2**](https://github.com/expressjs/express/releases/tag/5.0.0-beta.2) by [this](https://github.com/expressjs/express/commit/0867302ddbde0e9463d0564fea5861feb708c2dd) commit.

Improved handling for the bypass was added in [**4.19.2**](https://github.com/expressjs/express/releases/tag/4.19.2) and [**5.0.0-beta.3**](https://github.com/expressjs/express/releases/tag/v5.0.0-beta.3) and  by [this](https://github.com/expressjs/express/commit/0b746953c4bd8e377123527db11f9cd866e39f94) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/expressjs/express/tags).

## Workaround
The vendor has stated [here](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rv95-896h-c2vc) the following as a workaround  "The fix for this involves pre-parsing the url string with either `require('node:url').parse` or `new URL`. These are steps you can take on your own before passing the user input string to `res.location` or `res.redirect`."

## Description
The braces package for Node.js contains a bad regular expression that causes catastrophic back tracking. If an application is supplying untrusted input to this module, it is possible for an attacker to input a string that will cause the application to hang or possibly crash due to resource exhaustion. This is better known as a regular expression denial-of-service (ReDoS).

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2024-5371](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2024-5371)([CVE-2024-38808](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38808)) - Spring Framework Vulnerable to Denial-of Service (DoS) via Specially Crafted Spring Expression Language (SpEL) Expression


## Solution
Fixed in version [**5.3.39**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v5.3.39) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/f44d13cb7816e586b86c02421af4f5498391111c) commit.

## Workaround
The vendor notes [here](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38808):

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-beans 5.3.33-wso2v2 (BDSA-2024-6258)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework contains a path traversal flaw when used to serve static resources through the functional web frameworks `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn`. A remote attacker could leverage this to read arbitrary files that the application has system read rights to.

**Note**: The application is only vulnerable when it uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources and resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location.

## Description
Spring Framework contains a path traversal flaw when used to serve static resources through the functional web frameworks `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn`. A remote attacker could leverage this to read arbitrary files that the application has system read rights to.

**Note**: The application is only vulnerable when it uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources and resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2024-6258](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2024-6258) - Spring Framework Vulnerable to Arbitrary File Read via Path Traversal in WebMvc.fn or WebFlux.fn Components



## Solution
Fixed in [**6.2.0-rc2**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.2.0-RC2) and [**6.1.14**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.1.14) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/3bfbe30a7814c9ea1556d40df9bd87ddb3ba372d) commit and [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/fb7890d73975a3d9e0763e0926df2bd0a608e87e) commit.

The latest stable releases are available [here](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases).

## Workaround
The vendor supplies the following suggestion [here](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38816):
> Users of older, unsupported versions could enable Spring Security's Firewall in their application, or switch to using Tomcat or Jetty as a Web server because they reject such malicious requests.

* [**5.3.38**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v5.3.38) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/582bfccbb7) commit.
* [**6.0.23**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.0.23) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/8d16a50907c11f7e6b407d878a26e84eba08a533) commit.
* [**6.1.12**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.1.12) and [**6.2.0-M7**](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/releases/tag/v6.2.0-M7) by [this](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/commit/bb17ad8314b81850a939fd265fb53b3361705e85) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/tags).

## Workaround
The vendor notes [here](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38809):
> Users of older, unsupported versions could enforce a size limit on "If-Match" and "If-None-Match" headers, e.g. through a Filter.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-beans 5.3.33-wso2v2 (BDSA-2024-7391)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a path traversal issue due to a lack of sufficient sanitization of path sequences processed by the `WebMvc.fn` or `WebFlux.fn` functional web frameworks.

A remote attacker could submit crafted HTTP requests to an application that serves static resources through the affected frameworks in order to read any file on the system that is accessible to the process in which the Spring application is running.

An application is vulnerable when both of the following are true:
* the web application uses `RouterFunctions` to serve static resources, and
* resource handling is explicitly configured with a `FileSystemResource` location

The vendor has noted in the official [advisory](https://spring.io/security/cve-2024-38819) that malicious requests are blocked and rejected when the Spring Security HTTP Firewall is in use.

**Note**: This issue exists due to an insufficient fix for the previously reported path traversal issue **CVE-2024-38816** (**BDSA-2024-6528**). Unlike **CVE-2024-38816**, applications deployed on Tomcat or Jetty are vulnerable.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-beans 5.3.33-wso2v2 (BDSA-2025-8611)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to path traversal when it has been deployed on a non-compliant servlet container. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in order to view sensitive information.

An application can be vulnerable when all the following are true:
* the application is deployed as a WAR or with an embedded Servlet container,
* the Servlet container does not reject suspicious sequences,
* the application serves static resources with Spring resource handling.

**Note**: The vendor has stated that applications deployed on Apache Tomcat or Eclipse Jetty are not vulnerable, as long as default security features are not disabled in the configuration.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-beans 5.3.33-wso2v2 (BDSA-2025-11864)

fullDescription.text:
The Spring Framework might not correctly detect annotations on methods if those methods are part of a class hierarchy that uses generic types without specific type limits. If these annotations are used for authorization purposes, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability in order to reveal information that they should not have access to.

**Note:** The vendor has stated that only instances of spring that use the `@EnableMethodSecurity` setting or use security annotations on methods in generic superclasses or generic interfaces are vulnerable.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-beans 5.3.33-wso2v2 (BDSA-2025-13947)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) issue due to the presence of a security bypass flaw in the STOMP protocol functionality. Applications that use STOMP over WebSocket are affected by this issue.

An attacker could trick a victim user into viewing crafted web content that sends requests to an affected application and abuses improper state management to bypass security measures and send unauthorized messages on the victim user's behalf.

shortDescription.text: Dependency: spring-beans 5.3.33-wso2v2 (CVE-2024-38820 BDSA-2024-7393)

fullDescription.text:
Spring Framework contains locale-dependent exceptions in the `disallowedFields` patterns in the `DataBinder` component. This could allow an attacker to bypass field protections and potentially manipulate protected fields.

**Note:** after this CVE was fixed it was discovered that there are still cases where it is possible to bypass the disallowedFields checks, resulting in **CVE-2025-22233** and a second fix.

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: lodash 2.4.2 from zaproxy 0.2.0 (BDSA-2019-3842)

fullDescription.text:
Lodash contains a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability.  This is due to multiple methods not validating the length of content supplied to it.  If an application is passing untrusted-input to the Lodash library, it may be possible for an attacker to cause the process to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.

Please note that this issue is not considered by the vendor to be a vulnerability in Lodash, however it could be exploited if an application using Lodash accepts user input without validation and passes it to the affected functions. A pull request was opened to update the Lodash documentation regarding this issue but it was closed and not merged.

## Description
Apache Commons Lang is affected by an uncontrolled recursion vulnerability in the `ClassUtils.getClass` method. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw by providing excessively long or deeply nested input strings, leading to a StackOverflowError and resulting in a denial-of-service (DoS) condition.

## Vulnerabilities(BDSA,CVE)
:yellow_circle: [BDSA-2025-6881](https://openhub.net/vulnerabilities/bdsa/BDSA-2025-6881)([CVE-2025-48924](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-48924)) - Apache Commons Lang Vulnerable to Denial-of-Service (DoS) via Uncontrolled Recursion leading to Stack Overflow in 'ClassUtils.getClass' Method


## Solution
Fixed in version [**3.18.0-RC1**](https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/releases/tag/commons-lang-3.18.0-RC1) by [this](https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/b424803abdb2bec818e4fbcb251ce031c22aca53) commit.

The latest stable releases can be found [here](https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/tags).

shortDescription.text: Transitive Dependency: set-value 0.4.3 from nodemon 1.19.1 (CVE-2019-10747 BDSA-2019-4362)

fullDescription.text:
set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).

## Description
set-value is vulnerable to prototype pollution due to insufficient input validation.  An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to modify the Object prototype properties which causes additional properties or changes to the objects which could result in denial-of-service (DoS) or alter the integrity of the application. If the application uses polluted objects in conjunction with code execution primitives (such as eval), it may be possible for an attacker to execute malicious code.

It was later determined that this issue could be bypassed via a type confusion vulnerability as noted in **CVE-2021-23440** (**BDSA-2021-2911**).
